findings.title: Contract deployment could potentially fail when there are too many merchants
findings.description: The `MigrateFactory` constructor iterates over every single element in the `merchants` array. If the array gets large enough, this operation will exceed the block gas limit and eventually fail.

findings.title: Upgraded factories can potentially corrupt state
findings.description: When the protocol upgrades its factory, there is nothing on-chain that guarantees that the new factory has an identical state to the old factory. This can cause issues such as mint/burn requests, custodian deposit addresses and merchant deposit addresses potentially getting lost or corrupt.

findings.title: IndexedMapping.sol: Contract could save on gas by removing the valueExists mapping
findings.description: The IndexedMapping library could save on gas by removing the valueExists mapping and using a 1-based index for the valueIndex mapping.

findings.title: Redundant Argument depositAddress
findings.description: The `depositAddress` argument can always be retrieved by calling `custodianDepositAddress[msg.sender]`, and is therefore not required to be provided by the caller.

findings.title: Incorrect Comment
findings.description: In function `addMintRequest()` there is a mismatch between actual return type (`uint256`) and its NatSpec documentation (`bool`)
